thread.title_full: 2 cats, 1 bird die in Tiki Island RV struck by lightning | Local News | The Daily News

author: LAUREN FRICK The Daily News
title: 2 cats, 1 bird die in Tiki Island RV struck by lightning | Local News | The Daily News
text:
TIKI ISLAND
A lightning bolt struck a recreational vehicle during a thunderstorm early Wednesday, causing a fire that killed pets inside, the Tiki Island Fire Department said.
The department and Bayou Vista Fire Department responded to a 7 a.m. call at Tiki’s Tom’s RV Park, 4544 Jones Lake Road, officials said. By the time first responders arrived, the RV was completely engulfed in flames, Tiki Island firefighter DeMarcus Foreman said.
It took first responders nearly two hours to put out the fire, Foreman said.
“It just took so long with how much the storm was going on and how much fire was coming out of it,” Foreman said.
One person was in the RV when it caught fire, but no injuries were reported, Foreman said. Two cats and one bird that were inside the RV died in the fire.
No injuries or cases of smoke inhalation were reported from residents in the park living next to the RV that caught fire, Foreman said.
The RV struck by lightning was the only vehicle in the park damaged. The vehicle was destroyed, he said.
